headline: Analysts Say ‘Load Up’ on These 2 Nuclear Power Stocks — Here’s Why
summary: The widespread push toward energy sector decarbonization is well underway, and usually turns investor attention toward wind or solar power. But nuclear power is rapidly gaining interest – it’s inherently more reliable than wind or solar, and leaves a minimal carbon footprint – although long-term storage of spent fuel does remain an issue. That shift is being driven by rising demand for reliable baseload power – particularly from energy-hungry data centers – a trend Northland analyst Jeff Grampp
